markdownRemark.html:
To me, 2018 was the year that VS Code really blew up in popularity. Suddenly social media was abuzz with people blogging about their setups and how in love they are.

So although I was trying to be a hardcore Atom lover, once Microsoft acquired Github I figured I might as well make the switch, because no one is nearly as obsessed with Atom like they are for Visual Studio Code and since now Microsoft owned both editors, I might as well switch to the preferred child.

AND since Iâ€™m not working at the moment and have a bit of time during baby naps to just nerd out, I got to spend a lot of time researching and getting my setup juust right.

First up: The icon

Iâ€™m not usually one to replace app icons to be honest, it just seems a bitâ€¦ extreme? Like it feels more pure to stick with how the vendor intended it to be. BUT. I just really didnâ€™t like the existing icon and I decided to break my usual rule ðŸ˜„

I decided to go with this icon by Lex Tang. It looks pretty good:
